snippet: The National Theater of Wales staging of “The Radicalisation of Bradley Manning” opens a three-week run at the Edinburgh Festival, and the timing could hardly be better.
abstract: National Theater of Wales staging of play The Radicalisation of Bradley Manning is opening three-week run as part of the British Council showcase at the Edinburgh Festival; play's run comes as public is highly attuned to Manning, whose trial began in June, and questions raised about legality and morality of whistle-blowing; play's author Tim Price says he feels kinship with Manning, whose mother is Welsh.
lead_paragraph: The National Theater of Wales staging of “The Radicalisation of Bradley Manning” opens a three-week run at the Edinburgh Festival, and the timing could hardly be better.

headline.seo: ‘Radicalisation of Bradley Manning’ Hits Home in Edinburgh
headline.main: Whistle-Blower Has Inspired a Welsh Troupe
headline.print_headline: Whistle-Blower Has Inspired A Welsh Troupe
